Johnson & Johnson Python PySpark Academy

Professional Clinical Programming Training Program

Instructor: Simon Renauld | Duration: 6 Modules | Students: 300+ Global

Program Scope & Purpose

Purpose: Development of an in-house training program for basic Python (focused on PySpark)

Scope: Support upskilling of Clinical Programming staff (J&J and all vendors). Developing a training academy and materials that can potentially be added to the J&J LMS system, becoming part of the role-specific training matrix.

Program Requirements

  • Location: Europe-based development, Global delivery
  • Students: 300+ clinical programming professionals
  • Delivery: Online/Remote with automated/recorded sessions
  • Format: Short-duration topics with practical Databricks notebooks
  • Structure: Modular approach with pilot cohorts for each new module
  • Outcome: Utilize PySpark for data manipulation within Databricks

Databricks Integration

All practical exercises and demonstrations utilize the Johnson & Johnson Databricks platform:

Access Databricks Notebooks Collection

Note: Access requires J&J corporate credentials and appropriate Databricks workspace permissions.

Module 1: System Setup

Duration: 1 hour Sessions: 9

Professional development environment configuration for clinical programming workflows.

View All Sessions
  • 1.1: Welcome & Introduction
  • 1.2: Installing Python
  • 1.3: Installing Jupyter Notebooks
  • 1.4: Installing Git and Bitbucket
  • 1.5: Installing PySpark
  • 1.6: Setting Up Virtual Environments
  • 1.7: Configuring Environment Variables
  • 1.8: Testing the Setup
  • 1.9: Accessing Learning Resources

Module 2: Core Python

Duration: 2 hours Sessions: 15

Python fundamentals focused on healthcare data processing and clinical programming applications.

View All Sessions
  • 2.1: Welcome & Introduction
  • 2.2: Python Basics (Variables, Types, Ops)
  • 2.3: Control Structures (If, Loops)
  • 2.4: Functions and Modules
  • 2.5: Data Structures
  • 2.6: File I/O
  • 2.7: Error and Exception Handling

  • 2.10: Decorators
  • 2.11: Virtual Environments
  • 2.12: Context Managers
  • 2.13: Iterators and Generators
  • 2.14: String Processing
  • 2.15: APIs and JSON

Module 3: PySpark

Duration: 1.5 hours Sessions: 14

Distributed computing with PySpark for large-scale clinical data processing and analytics.

View All Sessions
  • 3.1: Welcome & Introduction
  • 3.2: Setting Up PySpark
  • 3.3: SparkSession and SparkContext
  • 3.4: RDD Fundamentals
  • 3.5: DataFrames Basics

  • 3.7: PySpark SQL

  • 3.10: Window Functions
  • 3.11: Reading and Writing Data
  • 3.12: Performance Tuning Basics
  • 3.13: Error Handling and Debugging
  • 3.14: Practical Exercises

Duration: 1 hour Sessions: 8

Version control and collaboration for clinical programming projects using corporate Git/Bitbucket.

Module 5: Databricks

Duration: 1.5 hours Sessions: 8

Cloud analytics platform mastery for enterprise healthcare data science and clinical programming.

Module 6: Advanced

Duration: 1 hour Sessions: 8

Advanced techniques, optimization, and real-world clinical data pipeline development.

  • 6.7: Deployment Strategies
  • 6.8: Capstone Project

Program Delivery Structure

  • Format: Recorded short-duration topics with practical Databricks notebooks
  • Assessment: Quiz at the end of each module
  • Pilot Approach: Small pilot cohort for each new module before open access
  • Support: DU-SME led technical sessions for continuous learning
  • Certification: To be confirmed by J&J LMS team
  • Maintenance: J&J resources identified for November handover

Learning Outcomes

Upon completion, clinical programming staff will be able to:

  • Utilize PySpark for data manipulation within Databricks
  • Process large-scale clinical datasets efficiently
  • Implement data pipelines for clinical programming workflows
  • Apply version control best practices for collaborative projects
  • Develop professional, maintainable clinical programming solutions
  • Integrate with existing J&J data infrastructure and compliance requirements
